element.name: Rat-Motte by dmmarron_99, Traditional Cache (1.5/2)
element.long-description: Not too difficult to find but some last minute circle-spinning may be required! Please approach and replace the cache with care as this is a sensitive historical area. Depending on the time of year, the approach to the cache site can be slippery so appropriate footwear is recommended. It is likely that it was this second Hugh de Lacy who erected that large moat that stands out so prominently adjacent to the Catholic Church in the village. The site was well chosen. The summit commands a view of most of the barony. It had all the other characteristics of the typical Norman fort – a keep. Bailium, fosse, etc. The Normans had to defend themselves in a new country that was thinly populated and almost without roads. They set up their own courts to administer justice and keep the peace. As in England, the native population in the area made no resistance. It was not so along the borders where the native kings raided the Norman territory just as they raided and were raided by their neighbours. Before long Ratoath was well inside the Norman territory and it was not necessary for them to build a stone castle for defence such as they erected at Duleek, Slane, Dunshaughlin, etc. It may have been this Hugh de Lacy too, that erected the first Church in Ratoath as the site in the old cemetery was just then right by Norman practice. On the other hand, the fact that’s patron is the Most Holy Trinity suggests either as earlier foundation, as the Normans usually dedicated their churches to Our Blessed Lady or to one of the saints, or that they borrowed the title from an existing church in the neighbourhood. Don't forget to record your visit in the log book and on the geocaching web site later. Thanks. Enjoy.

ul.li:
2010-06-17T19:00:00Z : Found it by Spark_ie
Nice cache, certainly wouldn't notice this place behind the church, especially with all the tree cover. Pretty steep mound alright, must come back in winter time where there's no leaves to get a proper view ! TFTC, Spark_ie

2010-05-23T19:00:00Z : Found it by woodface
[Found fairly easily but journey is troublesome with young kids - took toy car and left Toy Story figure.] Recommend sturdy shoes and long trousers as ascent/descent is steep and slippery.

2010-05-20T19:00:00Z : Found it by thomasvm
Interesting locations in the middle of Ratoath - found it easily - it was on the ground and items were a bit damp. TFTC

2010-04-13T19:00:00Z : Found it by geo_georgie
easy find close to home darragh replaced toy car for marble

2010-03-21T21:15:28Z : Needs Maintenance by Mullingar Man
log is wet - visit required to sort this out cheers
